etomica.box

Class Box

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.box.Box
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBox, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoxCluster

    public class Box
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, IBox
    A Box collects all atoms that interact with one another; atoms in different boxs do not interact. These are the important features of a Box:

    1. It holds a SpeciesMaster instance, which provides the root of a hierarchy of atoms that represent the physical objects that interact.
    2. It holds a Boundary object, obtained from the governing Space, that defines the volume of the box and the behavior of atoms as they move into or across the boundary of the box.
    3. It maintains a list of listeners that are informed when significant events happen in the box (such as a change in its boundary).
    4. Each Box has a unique index assigned when it is constructed. The index assignment begins at 0 and is incremented after each Box construction. This index is useful when collecting things in reference to the box.
    A box is acted upon by an Integrator instance to move its atoms around and generate configurations. Properties of a box are measured by MeterAbstract instances which are simply DataSource objects that require a box to generate their data.
    A simulation may involve more than one box. All Box instances are registered with the simulation specified upon their construction, and may be accessed via the simulation's getBoxs method.
    See Also:
    Boundary, Serialized Form

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int newIndex)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Informs the IBox what its index is. This should only be called by the ISimulation.
        Specified by:
        setIndex in interface IBox

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Returns the IBox's index. The index corresponds to the box's position in the simulation's list of IBoxes. The index of the first IBox is 0. The index of the last IBox is n-1, where n is the number of IBoxes.
        Specified by:
        getIndex in interface IBox

      • addMolecule

        public void addMolecule(IMolecule molecule)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Adds the given molecule to the this box. The molecule should not already be in this box and should not be in another IBox. The molecule should be a member of an ISpecies which has been added to the ISimulation.
        Specified by:
        addMolecule in interface IBox

      • removeMolecule

        public void removeMolecule(IMolecule molecule)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Removes the given molecule from this box. The molecule must be held by the box before this method is called.
        Specified by:
        removeMolecule in interface IBox

      • setNMolecules

        public void setNMolecules(ISpecies species,
                          int n)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Sets the number of molecules in this box of the given ISpecies to n. Molecules are added to or removed from the box to achieve the desired number.
        Specified by:

      • addSpeciesNotify

        public void addSpeciesNotify(ISpecies species)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Notifies the IBox that the given species has been added to the simulation. This method should only be called by the simulation.
        Specified by:
        addSpeciesNotify in interface IBox

      • removeSpeciesNotify

        public void removeSpeciesNotify(ISpecies species)
        Description copied from interface: IBox
        Notifies the IBox that a Species has been removed. This method should only be called by the simulation. This triggers the removal of all molecules of the given species from this box.
        Specified by:
        removeSpeciesNotify in interface IBox

      • notifyNewMolecules

        protected void notifyNewMolecules(ISpecies species,
                                  int numNewMolecules,
                                  int moleculeLeafAtoms)
        Notifies the SpeciesMaster that the given number of new Atoms will be added to the system. It's not required to call this method before adding atoms, but if adding many Atoms, calling this will improve performance.
